channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech

item.title: So long, Life360: This privacy-minded service is location sharing done right
item.description: When we talk about phones and location sharing, we’re typically talking about limiting how much info overly aggressive apps can access. But there’s another side to location sharing—and that’s actively opting to share your location with specific people (not companies!) for your own personal purposes.
item.dc:creator: JR Raphael, Fast Company

item.title: Everything new on Disney+ in November 2025: The Fantastic Four: First Steps, All's Fair, and more
item.description: From The Fantastic Four's latest big-screen adventure to Kim Kardashian's new TV show, here's what's coming to Disney+ this month.
item.dc:creator: Tom Power, TechRadar

item.title: AI buildout cements its role as a global catalyst this week
item.description: A momentous week in the technology sector made it clear there is no sign the boom in building artificial intelligence infrastructure is slowing — despite the bubble talk. Nvidia, whose processors are the AI revolution’s backbone, became the first company to surpass $5 trillion in market value.
item.dc:creator: Reuters, Fast Company

item.title: 6 new Apple TV+ movies and shows to watch in November 2025
item.description: Every new Apple TV+ movie and show being released throughout November 2025 that you need to know about.
item.dc:creator: Amelia Schwanke, TechRadar

item.title: How Apple managed to deliver a strong third quarter despite a global trade war
item.description: Apple delivered financial results during its summertime quarter that exceeded analyst projections, despite being caught in the crosshairs of a global trade war at the same time the trendsetting company is scrambling to catch up to its Big Tech peers in the artificial intelligence race.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fast Company

item.title: A new study found a surprising source of social media toxicity
item.description: It’s widely known that social media can quickly turn into a toxic cesspool of hate speech and ragebait, particularly during times of political turmoil. Across social media platforms, amplified by the algorithm, hate often breeds hate.
item.dc:creator: Eve Upton-Clark, Fast Company

item.title: AI systems will learn bad behavior to meet performance goals, suggest researchers
item.description: There are plenty of stories out there about how politicians, sales representatives, and influencers, will exaggerate or distort the facts in order to win votes, sales, or clicks, even when they know they shouldn’t. It turns out that AI models, too, can suffer from these decidedly human failings.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: OpenAI’s Atlas ushers in the era of AI browsing. Here’s what it means for media
item.description: For the past 30 years, the web browser has been the primary way humans navigate the internet. It makes sense, then, that as artificial intelligence becomes more humanlike in its capabilities, it would use the same tool.
item.dc:creator: Pete Pachal, Fast Company

item.title: Rust 1.91 promotes Windows on Arm64 to Tier 1 target
item.description: The Rust Release Team has released Rust 1.91, an update of the popular memory-safe programming language that promotes Windows on Arm64 platform to a Tier 1 supported target. Rust 1.91 was announced October 30. Previous users can upgrade by running rustup update stable.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Apple delivers strong quarter despite trade war challenges and ongoing artificial technology issues
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Apple delivered financial results during its summertime quarter that exceeded analyst projections, despite being caught in the crosshairs of a global trade war at the same time the trendsetting company is scrambling to catch up to its Big Tech peers in the artificial intelligenc
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: How tiny drones inspired by bats could save lives in dark and stormy conditions
item.description: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) — Don't be fooled by the fog machine, spooky lights and fake bats: the robotics lab at Worcester Polytechnic Institute lab isn't hosting a Halloween party.
item.dc:creator: HOLLY RAMER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Nvidia valuation reaches $5 trillion
item.description:
The value of Nvidia’s stock has increased significantly in recent years, largely due to the high demand for its AI chips.
According to Reuters, another milestone was passed during Wednesday’s trading on the Nasdaq stock exchange, as Nvidia became the first company to be valued at $5 trillion.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Adobe AI assistants let you edit images in Photoshop and Express via prompts
item.description: Adobe is developing new generative AI (genAI) assistants that let users edit images in Adobe Express and Photoshop with written prompts. Having embedded AI-based content-generation tools across its apps in recent years, Adobe is rolling out AI assistants and agents.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Microsoft Forms cheat sheet: How to get started
item.description: Microsoft Forms is a web app that allows users to create various types of forms that gather information from people online and store that data in the cloud for review. Why is this useful? Surveys, questionnaires, and other interactive forms are a vital part of doing business.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Oracle’s cloud strategy an increasingly risky bet
item.description: The financing arrangement for Oracle’s massive data center plan aimed at feeding the AI monster could result in a $38 billion debt offering as soon as next week, and according to this week’s report from Morgan Stanley, that figure could skyrocket to $55 billion – $75 billion as a result of the “shee
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Broadcom refuses to backtrack on huge VMware price increases, claims European cloud watchdog
item.description: Broadcom is still trying to strongarm VMware customers into accepting huge price increases and onerous licensing terms, says the European Cloud Competition Observatory (ECCO) in its latest report.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Meta shares slide after company projects higher expenses for 2026
item.description: Meta's stock slid in after-hours trading on Wednesday after the tech giant posted strong third-quarter results but warned that its expenses will be significantly higher in 2026 than this year. Like its rivals, Meta Platforms Inc.
item.dc:creator: BARBARA ORTUTAY, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Google's corporate parent posts first-ever quarter with $100B in revenue in latest show of its power
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Google’s corporate parent on Wednesday announced its first-ever quarter with more than $100 billion in revenue, a milestone that illustrates the unwavering power of its internet empire amid legal and competitive threats. The news of Alphabet Inc.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Microsoft deploys a fix to Azure cloud service that's hit with outage
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Microsoft has deployed a fix to address an outage of their Azure cloud portal that left users unable to access Office 365, Minecraft and other services.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Nvidia has started the $5 trillion club. A look at its rise, by the numbers
item.description: Nvidia on Wednesday became the first public company to reach a market capitalization of $5 trillion. The ravenous appetite for the Silicon Valley company's chips is the main reason that the company’s stock price has increased so rapidly since early 2023.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Trump Media entering predictive market space
item.description: Parent company Trump Media announced a partnership to allow users to trade predictive contracts on events.
item.dc:creator: Steph Whiteside, NewsNation

item.title: Character.AI is banning minors from interacting with its chatbots
item.description: Character.AI is banning minors from using its chatbots amid growing concerns about the effects of artificial intelligence conversations on children.
item.dc:creator: BARBARA ORTUTAY, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Arista fills out AI networking portfolio
item.description: Arista Networks has added more models, greater speed, and new line cards to its portfolio of high-performance networking gear targeting large-scale AI and cloud data center customers.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Apple Watch Series 11: The things you don’t see
item.description: While there were solid improvements in the last generation of Apple’s popular wearable, the huge 24-hour battery life in Apple Watch Series 11 means this smartwatch has finally become what it always promised to be: a device capable of running all day and all night, which is especially for tasks like
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Eight Sleep adds outage mode after AWS disruption
item.description: Mattress owners reported that their beds were stuck at sweltering temperatures and uncomfortable incline positions.
item.dc:creator: Taylor Delandro, NewsNation

item.title: Nvidia becomes world’s first $5 trillion company
item.description: Nvidia on Wednesday became the first company in the world to reach a $5 trillion valuation. The chipmaker’s stock jumped 3 percent at market open, pushing the company above the historic milestone.
item.dc:creator: Julia Shapero, The Hill

item.title: Startup giving away 3 billion free ads to help US businesses
item.description: Australian startup Cuttable is looking to change the landscape of e-commerce advertising in the United States.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Djordjevic, NewsNation

item.title: Nvidia looks to power AI factory networks
item.description: Networking technology took center stage at Nvidia’s GTC DC developers show in Washington, D.C. as a range of networking products were introduced for high-performance AI inference processing and more.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: The future of federal cybersecurity depends on agencies uniting around one language of risk
item.description: Technology alone won't ensure resilience. The strongest control is culture — a mindset that embraces innovation, fosters collaboration and supports automation. The post The future of federal cybersecurity depends on agencies uniting around one language of risk first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: commentators, Federal News Network

item.title: Stragglers from Myanmar scam center raided by army cross into Thailand as buildings are blown up
item.description: BANGKOK (AP) — The number of people fleeing from Myanmar to Thailand after Myanmar’s military shut down a major online scam center has slowed to a trickle, a Thai regional army commander said Tuesday, after more than 1,500 had left in the past week.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: How to vibe code for free, or almost free
item.description: Many developers haven’t yet crossed over to LLM-based code generation, whether it’s vibe coding, spec development, agentic engineering, or whatever your flavor may be. And if you’re not convinced, you’re probably not going to shell out real money for it just yet.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Anthropic draws fire from White House with AI warnings
item.description: Anthropic has been a rare voice within the artificial intelligence (AI) industry cautioning about the downsides of the technology it develops and supporting regulation — a stance that has recently drawn the ire of the Trump administration and its allies in Silicon Valley.
item.dc:creator: Julia Shapero, The Hill

item.title: Beware fake credit card account restriction scams
item.description: A phishing email scam targeting American Express customers shows how cybercriminals use fake urgent messages to steal personal and financial information.
item.dc:creator: Fox News
